frame.name: Renting
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Lessee</fen> gains the use of <fen>Goods</fen> owned by a <fen>Lessor</fen> by payment to the <fen>Lessor</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Lessee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual that gains temporary use of the <fen>Goods</fen> by paying the <fen>Lessor</fen>
<ex><fex name="Lessee">We</fex> 've been <t>renting</t> from him for years .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE <fen>Goods</fen> is an item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>I tried to <t>hire</t> <fex name="Goods">a bicycle</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. <ex> Will they allow you to <t>lease</t> the airfield <fex name="Mns">by check</fex>? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for tempory use of the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>Sam <t>chartered</t> the ship <fex name="Money">for only $12,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In isome cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex> Jon <t>rented</t> a car for <fex name="Rate">twenty dollars a day</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Lessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual who has permanent ownership of the <fen>Goods</fen> and allows them to be used by the Lessee temporarily.
<ex>Kim and Pat <t>rent</t> the apartment <fex name="Lessor">from Jess</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Lee <t>rents</t> rooms <fex name="Unit">by the hour</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location the renting takes place.
<ex>I <t>rented</t> the car <fex name="Place">right next to the airport</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose for which the renting is performed.
<ex>Though he was already wanted , he <t>rented</t> a car <fex name="Purpose">to make a getaway</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state-of-affairs from which the renting logically follows.
</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Lessee</fen>that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>She quit her old job and <fex name="Manner">gleefully</fex> <t>leased</t> a cheap, Upper East Side apartment.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual intended by the <fen>Lessee</fen> to receive the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>She <t>rented</t> <fex name="Recipient">him</fex> a cadillac from the lot next door and they hit the road .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Goods</fen> are (or have been) in the <fen>Lessee</fen>'s possession.
<ex>Our neighbors have been <t>renting</t> their house <fex name="Duration">for the last ten years</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose_of_goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Lessee</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>I <t>rented</t> a computer<fex name="POG">to sit in my office</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj.; pay someone for the use of.

lexUnit.name: charter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: hire (an aircraft, ship, or motor vehicle).

lexUnit.name: hire.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: obtain the temporary use of in return for payment.
